definitions.definition: To confirm and pay for goods and services at a facility (e.g.: supermarket, online store, hotel) when leaving.
definitions.example: Be sure to check out of the hotel before noon.

definitions.definition: To withdraw (an item), as from a library, and have the withdrawal recorded.
definitions.example: He checked his favorite mystery out for the twenty-third time.

definitions.definition: To record (someone) as leaving the premises or as taking something therefrom, as from a library or shop.
definitions.example: The desk clerk checked out the family that had been staying in room 322.

definitions.definition: To examine, inspect, look at closely, ogle; to investigate; to gather information so as to make a decision.
definitions.example: Check it out! Best prices in town.

definitions.definition: To obtain source code from a repository.
To become uninterested in an activity and cease to participate in more than a perfunctory manner; to become uncooperative.
To become catatonic or otherwise nonresponsive.
To prove (after an investigation) to be the case, or to be in order.
definitions.example: The first two leads check out; I'll assume the third one is also valid.
